content: life s not a race crochet pattern by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful https //www ravelry com/designers/susan-e-kennedy @prettypeacefulcrochet on instagram pretty peaceful on facebook pretty peaceful youtube video tutorials size about 3 feet by 5 feet 91 by 152 cm the blanket is worked along the long edge to create lengthwise stripes you can make a longer blanket by adding any number of stitches to your starting chain you can make a wider blanket by working more row yarn any dk weight or light worsted weight yarn light category 3 the yarn is held doubled crocheting with two strands held together as if they were one strand you will need 2 360 yards 2 160 meters of yarn the sample blanket used 4 cakes of lion brand mandala yarn in fairy 100% acrylic 590 yards 540 m per 150-gram cake you can use any yarn you like be aware that your blanket may be larger or smaller than the dimensions listed here if you use a different yarn or hook size let the mandala colors flow without cutting the yarn or switching the order of the colors it is okay if the color changes of the two strands of yarn do not line up perfectly that is the beauty of this blanket video tutorial watch how to make the blanket in the life s not a race tutorial video https //youtu be/mt6xjggwqkq the photo to the right shows the blanket being used by a 5 9 teen 175 cm tall life s not a race crochet pattern © 2020 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful yarn weight light dk or light worsted weight yarn is held doubled hook size 8 mm us l gauge 7 5 double_crochet stitches = 4 inches 10 cm 6 5 row = 4 inches 10 cm terms us chain chain yarn over and pull through loop on hook sts stitches double_crochet double_crochet yarn over insert hook into stitch yarn over pull through stitch yarn over pull through two loops yarn over pull through both loops on hook foundation double_crochet optional a method for beginning a row without having to make a separate row of chains first video tutorial by tamara kelly of moogly com https //www youtube com/watch v=y__jxaqu8f0 csdc chainless starting double_crochet a method for beginning each row without having to chain first this method helps to keep your edges straight see http //www mooglyblog com/chainless-starting-double-crochet/ for a video tutorial pattern notes the blanket is all double_crochet stitches placed between the stitches of the row below instead of crocheting into the top loops of each stitch as usual life s not a race row 1 holding two strands of yarn together as if they were one chain 110 double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook counts as 1st stitch and all chains across 108 stitches made or holding two strands of yarn together as if they were one foundation double crochet 108 stitches see video link above for how to foundation double_crochet 108 stitches made
